newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian police say no leads in Maribor blast.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian police say no leads in Maribor blast.

text.p: Slovenian police said on Wednesday they had made little progress in investigating the latest in a series of blasts in the northeastern city of Maribor.
A bomb wrecked a bar in the Tuesday blast thought no-one was injured. It was the seventh such incident in the Maribor area, 135 km (80 miles) northeast of Ljubljana.
"We know it was an explosive device but we have not yet found who was responsible for it," Maribor police chief Srecko Pusnik told Reuters by telephone.
He said the authorities were satisfied that the seven attacks were unrelated.
"The explosive devices used in various Maribor explosions were very different from each other, while the motives also proved to be diverse," Pusnik said. He declined to give further details.
